title: Item build for highest possible AP?
body:
Hey guys!

With all the items in season 7, what is the current highest possible AP build? I'd like boots to be included as one of the items, so I guess only 5 slots are going to get used.

Thanks for your time!

Anyway, the answer to OPs question is;
{{item:3040}} {{item:3374}} {{item:3041}} {{item:3907}} {{item:3907}} {{item:3907}} {{item:2139}}. 
Item wise, its the most amount of AP you can get.

In detail:

2 ways based on movespeed or cooldown. So you'd either go predator and take celerity (nerfed, maybe not good anymore) or take transcendence (keystone doesn't matter here for raw ap - go whatever you want. probably domination too because eyeball collection).

I typically only play the CDR setup on Karthus, and it's usually bad too but i just like big numbers.

1. Rush Seraph's. You get the mana scaling, 20% CDR and AP.

2. Get Luden's. You get AP, more mana to scale the Seraph passive, and more CDR. You'll have 40% now.

3. From this point, any CDR you get gives you AP, any mana you get gives you AP. Every 100 mana would give you 3 AP, every 10% CDR would give you 24 AP.

Here's a few example items:

{{item:3030}} 80 base AP + 18 AP (mana) + 24 AP (CDR) = 122 AP
{{item:3100}} 80 base AP + 7.5 AP (mana) + 24 AP (CDR) = 111.5 AP
{{item:3115}} 80 base AP + 48 AP (CDR) = 128 AP
{{item:3027}} 100 base AP + 12 AP (mana) = 112 AP


Old Morellonomicon used to be perfect with the 20% CDR, 100 AP and ~400? mana it used to give but that no longer exists.

Sometime in your game, you'll obviously have to get {{item:3089}}.

As a standalone item, {{item:3041}} also gives a shitload of AP but you're unlikely to be able to get past the early game to snowball that far.
